reasoning: DIC secondary to sepsis/infection is the most common cause of DIC in hospitalized patients. Incidence estimates 0.8-5% of ICU patients (~3 per 100k in general population when accounting for ICU admission risk). Uses incidence metric for acute coagulation disorder with sepsis.
source: Gando S et al. (2016). Scientific Standardization Committee on DIC of the International Society on Thrombosis and Haemostasis. Thromb Res. 149:48-52
